choices.D: Use the Dialog.Delegate directive, including the full airport name in the outputSpeech object.
choices.E: Use the Dialog.ElicitSlot directive, including the full airport name in the updatedIntent object.
choices.B: Use the Dialog.ConfirmIntent directive, including the full airport name in the updatedIntent object.
choices.A: Use the Dialog.ConfirmSlot directive, including the full airport name in the outputSpeech object.
choices.C: Use the Dialog.Delegate directive, including the full airport name in the updatedIntent object.

questions.question_text:
A skill contains a PlanMyTrip intent configured to require slots fromCity and toCity. It contains the following interaction:
Alexa: What city are you leaving from?
User: I'm leaving from Seattle.
Alexa: You want to fly out of Seattle Tacoma International Airport, right?

User: Yes -
Which of the following should the Builder use to confirm the value of the fromCity slot only? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The answer is A and D.

You can include text for Alexa to speak in the outputSpeech object for all Dialog intents. For Dialog.Delegate, Alexa speaks this text before speaking the prompts defined in the dialog. For the other directives, Alexa uses this text to prompt for the elicitation or confirmation.

questions.question_text:
An Alexa Skill Builder is troubleshooting issues with a custom skill backed by an AWS Lambda function that integrates with an external API controlling a light bulb.
The Builder observes that when saying "Alexa, turn on the light" the response is "light is not responding" and 10 seconds later, the light turns on.
What is the MOST likely cause for this issue and how can it be solved?

choices.B: The default Lambda function timeout setting is too short and the Lambda function times out before the response from the external API can be processed and a reply can be sent back to Amazon Alexa. Increase the Lambda timeout limit.
choices.C: There are too many concurrent Lambda functions running, causing the existing Lambda function to block and then time out before a response can be returned to Amazon Alexa. Increase the Lambda function reserve concurrency value to 30, then verify that the function can complete its work within 10 seconds.
choices.D: There is a bug in the Lambda function code preventing the external API from being called. Enable Lambda debugging and error handling and check Amazon CloudWatch Logs for the error, then modify the code accordingly.
choices.A: The Lambda function is not executing fast enough. Double the currently specified Lambda memory allocation in the Lambda basic settings section.

When the skill is used with an Amazon Alexa enabled device with a screen, cards used in the skill are:

choices.C: rendered using the skill icon as the background image.
choices.B: rendered using the skill icon as the foreground image.
